keys.string: Class is going well until Arun goes off on a tangent.
My wife says I don’t have any gardening skills.
I’m not sure how we got here.
She thinks I’m the one who keeps killing out potted plants, but it’s her not me.
If I can just get one plant to live without her involvement, she’ll have to say that it’s not me.
But she’ll probably blame the dog before she admits defeat.
I really don’t understand whatever relationship dynamic is happening here, but I do understand what’s actually important in class. That’s gotta count for something right.
Conrad’s class is a lot more normal. He’s big into machine learning, obviously, but also, some functional programming.
I know this isn’t an easy class, but I’ll tell you what I do whenever I get stuck. I will write out what I want my program to do in functional pseudocode and the translate it over to imperative.
It’s a great way to avoid side effects and mutations in your code.
It’s good advice, but I’m not sure how practical it is. Well it works for him at least.
Amini walks into class… I’ve never noticed it before but, there is something captivating about him. What is it….
It is something so subtle.... HIS HAIR
It is layered with just the right amount of grey. He must really take pride in it. That’s like tender loving care levels of hair.
I’m not getting much from this lecture.. I can’t stop staring at his hair.
Just gonna keep staring. No one will think I’m creepy. I’m just really into the lecture.

ArrayOfString.string: [Narrator][Dialog]Class is going well until Arun goes off on a tangent.
[Arun][Dialog]My wife says I don’t have any gardening skills.
[Narrator][Dialog]I’m not sure how we got here.
[Arun][Dialog]She thinks I’m the one who keeps killing out potted plants, but it’s her not me.
[Arun][Dialog]If I can just get one plant to live without her involvement, she’ll have to say that it’s not me.
[Arun][Dialog]But she’ll probably blame the dog before she admits defeat.
[Narrator][Dialog]I really don’t understand whatever relationship dynamic is happening here, but I do understand what’s actually important in class. That’s gotta count for something right.
[Narrator][Dialog]Conrad’s class is a lot more normal. He’s big into machine learning, obviously, but also, some functional programming.

[Conrad][Dialog]I know this isn’t an easy class, but I’ll tell you what I do whenever I get stuck. I will write out what I want my program to do in functional pseudocode and the translate it over to imperative.
[Conrad][Dialog]It’s a great way to avoid side effects and mutations in your code.
[Narrator][Dialog]It’s good advice, but I’m not sure how practical it is. Well it works for him at least.
[Narrator][Dialog]Amini walks into class… I’ve never noticed it before but, there is something captivating about him. What is it….
[Narrator][Dialog]It is something so subtle.... HIS HAIR
[Narrator][Dialog]It is layered with just the right amount of grey. He must really take pride in it. That’s like tender loving care levels of hair.
[Narrator][Dialog]I’m not getting much from this lecture.. I can’t stop staring at his hair.
[Narrator][Dialog]Just gonna keep staring. No one will think I’m creepy. I’m just really into the lecture.
